reviewText: Jack Lemmon was an amazing actor, and both of these movies are outstanding, especially AVANTI.  My husband and I have watched it numerous times, and every time we enjoy it as if it were the first time.  It is funny and heartwarming, and having Billy Wilder as its Director, makes it a winner.

reviewText: DVS is of good quality for both movies. A bare bones edition with no scene selection or text for the hearing impaired, but the quality is high for basic viewing.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Two adventurous classics to swoon your romantic sides and leave you gleefully happy! As I don't give away plots,-Avanti is filled with the three, Death, Romance, and Mischief,...Oh yes, a 'twisting' story. You'll love this one. Also! As for Irma La Douce you get Underworld Backstreet Humor set in early France. List is just as interesting,-you get... Police, Ladies of the night, and acting so good you begin to think it's improve'(in the very best sense),... and did I say both stories have Beautiful co-stars! Yes, they're a trip back in time but the stories are just as fast moving and sometimes 'visual' as todays films. Stars include- Jack Lemmon, Juliet Mills, and the second-Jack Lemmon and Shirley MacLaine. If you're a progressive family, see them with your family of 'mid-teens'(and older).Five Stars. Enjoy!

reviewText: Bought this DVD for Avanti. Haven't watched Irma La Douce yet.Avanti is one of my favorite romantic comedies. If you don't laugh at Jack Lemmon dangling his wet black socks; then you don't have a sense of humor. Enjoyed this movie as a teenager, and again now. I'd recommend it to a friend.

reviewText: I could just eat these up with a spoon. Performances top notch. Simple fun for a lazy day to calm the nerves & to de-stress. Story plots engaging and overall well done. Bravo!

reviewText: Again, TGG Direct doesn't disappoint by putting two great Jack Lemmon and Billy Wilder movies together. Both movies are in great quality and each movie has there own disk with no special features. Also, there isn't any subtitles or any other audio languages besides English. Both movies are in color and Widescreen.-Avanti (1972/140mins)Lemmon, Juliet Mills, Clive Revill, Edward Andrews-Irma La Douce (1963/147mins)Lemmon, Shirley MacLaineOverall these are great MGM comedy movies and I would recommend this.
